page.title: 08THE SHEEPFOLD AT GAICH
page.content: At Gaich there is a sheepfold which used to be used for dipping sheep. The sheep were put in a main pen.A gate was opened to let in enough sheep to fill the second pen.When the men were ready they grabbed one of the sheep and dumped it in a dipper of disinfectant that killed ticks and other bothering insects. The sheep then clambered into a third pen which would begin to fill up with dipped sheep. The men would let the the dipped sheep out into the field when the third pen was full. This would carry on till all the sheep in the main pen had been dipped. Sheep still have to be dipped twice a year by law to prevent the spread of disease and pests but not in this fold.
